409/**
410 * @brief Lerp type when doing AutoPlayPositionTrack, AutoPlayRotationTrack, or AutoPlayBlendTrack.
411 * When a view has one of those active the view's time variable is then increased by GAME_DELTA_TIME.
412 */
413enum EnumCameraLerpType
414{
415 CMLT_NONE = 0, ///< time is set to time / speed.
416 CMLT_LINEAR = 1, ///< time is set to time / speed.
417 CMLT_LINEARLOOP = 2, ///< time is set to time / speed. If time is > 1.0 then time -= 1.0
418 CMLT_COSINE = 3, ///< time will never be higher than speed. time = CosTween(time * (1.0f / speed));
419 CMLT_COSINE_POW = 4 ///< time will never be higher than speed. time = CosTween(Pow(time * (1.0f / speed), 3));
420};

482enum EnumSectorPlatformFlags
483{
484 SPF_FLOORVERTS = (1 << 0), // Changes sectors verts origin
485 SPF_CEILINGVERTS = (1 << 1), // Changes sectors verts heights
486 SPF_SAMEAREA = (1 << 2), // Effects sectors only with the same area as the starting sector
487 SPF_MOVEPLAYERINAIR = (1 << 3), // Player moves with the sectors even in the air
488 SPF_USEMOVETOFORPLAYER = (1 << 4), // Uses the MoveToPosition function to set the Players origin. else sets origin.
489 SPF_USEMOVETOFORAI = (1 << 5), // Uses the MoveToPosition function to set the AI origin. else sets origin.
490 SPF_USEMOVETOFOROTHER = (1 << 6), // Uses the MoveToPosition function to set other actors origin. else sets origin.
491
492 SPF_DEFAULT = SPF_FLOORVERTS|SPF_CEILINGVERTS|SPF_MOVEPLAYERINAIR|SPF_USEMOVETOFORPLAYER
493};

513/**
514 * @class array<T>
515It is possible to declare array variables with the array identifier followed by the type of the elements within angle brackets.
516
517Example:
518
519@code{.cpp}
520 array<int> a, b, c;
521 array<Foo@> d;
522@endcode
523
524a, b, and c are now arrays of integers, and d is an array of handles to objects of the Foo type.
525
526When declaring arrays it is possible to define the initial size of the array by passing the length as a parameter to the constructor. The elements can also be individually initialized by specifying an initialization list. Example:
527
528@code{.cpp}
529 array<int> a; // A zero-length array of integers
530 array<int> b(3); // An array of integers with 3 elements
531 array<int> c(3, 1); // An array of integers with 3 elements, all set to 1 by default
532 array<int> d = {5,6,7}; // An array of integers with 3 elements with specific values
533@endcode
534
535Multidimensional arrays are supported as arrays of arrays, for example:
536
537@code{.cpp}
538 array<array<int>> a; // An empty array of arrays of integers
539 array<array<int>> b = {{1,2},{3,4}} // A 2 by 2 array with initialized values
540 array<array<int>> c(10, array<int>(10)); // A 10 by 10 array of integers with uninitialized values
541@endcode
542
543Each element in the array is accessed with the indexing operator. The indices are zero based, i.e. the range of valid indices are from 0 to length - 1.
544
545@code{.cpp}
546 a[0] = some_value;
547@endcode
548
549When the array stores handles the elements are assigned using the handle assignment.
550
551@code{.cpp}
552 // Declare an array with initial length 1
553 array<Foo@> arr(1);
554@endcode
555
556@code{.cpp}
557 // Set the first element to point to a new instance of Foo
558 @arr[0] = Foo();
559@endcode
560
561Arrays can also be created and initialized within expressions as anonymous objects.
562
563@code{.cpp}
564 // Call a function that expects an array of integers as input
565 foo(array<int> = {1,2,3,4});
566@endcode
567
568 */
569template <class T>
570class array // class array<T>
571{
572public:
573 void insertAt(uint index, const T&in value); ///< Inserts a new element into the array at the specified index.
574 void insertAt(uint index, const T[]&inout arr); ///< Inserts another array of elements into the array at the specified index.
575 void insertLast(const T&in value); ///< Appends an element at the end of the array.
576 void removeAt(uint index); ///< Removes the element at the specified index.
577 void removeLast(); ///< Removes the last element of the array.
578 void removeRange(uint start, uint count); ///< Removes count elements starting from start.
579 uint length() const; ///< Returns the length of the array.
580 void reserve(uint length);
581 void resize(uint length); ///< Sets the new length of the array.
582 void sortAsc(); ///< Sorts the elements in the array in ascending order. For object types, this will use the type's opCmp method.
583 void sortAsc(uint startAt, uint count); ///< Sorts only the elements starting at index startAt and the following count elements in the array in ascending order. For object types, this will use the type's opCmp method.
584 void sortDesc(); ///< Sorts the elements in the array in descending order. For object types, this will use the type's opCmp method.
585 void sortDesc(uint startAt, uint count); ///< Sorts only the elements starting at index startAt and the following count elements in the array in descending order. For object types, this will use the type's opCmp method.
586 void reverse(); ///< Reverses the order of the elements in the array.
587
588 /**
589 * @brief Returns the index of the first element that has the same value as the wanted value.
590 * For object types, this will use the type's opEquals or opCmp method to compare the value. For arrays of handles any null handle will be skipped.
591 * If no match is found will return a negative value.
592 */
593 int find(const T&in value) const;
594
595 /**
596 * @brief Returns the index of the first element that has the same value as the wanted value.
597 * For object types, this will use the type's opEquals or opCmp method to compare the value. For arrays of handles any null handle will be skipped.
598 * If no match is found will return a negative value.
599 */
600 int find(uint startAt, const T&in value) const;
601
602 /**
603 * @brief Searches for a matching address. These are especially useful for arrays of handles where specific instances of objects are desired, and not just objects that happen to have equal value.
604 * If no match is found will return a negative value.
605 */
606 int findByRef(const T&in value) const;
607
608 /**
609 * @brief Searches for a matching address. These are especially useful for arrays of handles where specific instances of objects are desired, and not just objects that happen to have equal value.
610 * If no match is found will return a negative value.
611 */
612 int findByRef(uint startAt, const T&in value) const;
613 bool isEmpty() const;
614 T& opIndex(uint index);
615 const T& opIndex(uint index) const;
616 T[]& opAssign(const T[]&in);
617 bool opEquals(const T[]&in) const;
618 funcdef bool less(const ?&in a, const ?&in b); ///< sorting function for sort
619 void sort(less&in, uint startAt = 0, uint count = uint ( - 1 )); ///< sorts array using the passed in less function
620};

1010 frame++;

1069/**
1070 * @class kActor
1071 * @brief Base type used by all actors.
1072 */
1073class kActor
1074{
1075public:
1076 const bool IsStale() const; ///< Actor is marked as removed and is waiting to be freed from memory when it next checks if there are no more references to this actor.
1077 kAngle& Yaw();
1078 kAngle& Pitch();
1079 kAngle& Roll();
1080 kVec3& Origin(); ///< Position in world space
1081 kVec3& Scale();
1082 kVec3& PrevOrigin();
1083 void SetTarget(kActor@ actor);
1084 kActor@ GetTarget();
1085 void SetSector(const uint sectorIndex);
1086 void Remove(); ///< Removes the actor and sets stale to true. Actor will only internally be removed when there are no references to this actor.
1087 kVec3& Velocity();
1088 kVec3& Movement();
1089 kQuat& Rotation();
1090 int16& Health();
1091 int& Type(); ///< The actors Type ID
1092 int& ImpactType(); ///< EnumImpactType
1093 int& ImpactTypeDmg(); ///< EnumImpactType. Overrides the damage def used. if is -1 (default) then does not override ImpactType()
1094 bool &IgnoreSectorHeightChange(void); ///< if true will not change position(or velocity and movement) when sector height changes.
1095 bool &IgnoreSectorPlatformChange(void); ///< if true this actor will not change position(or velocity and movement) when sector platform moves.
1096 int& ModelVariation();
1097 int& SpeciesMask();
1098 uint& Flags(); ///< EnumActorFlags
1099 const uint SpawnFlags1() const; ///< EnumActorSpawnFlags1
1100 const uint SpawnFlags2() const; ///< EnumActorSpawnFlags2
1101 const uint SpawnFlags3() const; ///< EnumActorSpawnFlags3
1102 const int TID() const;
1103 float& Radius();
1104 float& Height();
1105 float& StepHeight(); ///< AKA Dead Height. Used for moving up steps, figuring out if in waterheight, and the height of the actor when they are dead so you can still shoot them.
1106 float& WallRadius();
1107 float& Gravity();
1108 float& Friction();
1109 float& AnimSpeed();
1110 float& BounceDamp();
1111 float& FloorHeight();
1112 float& CeilingHeight();
1113 const int SectorIndex();
1114 const int AreaID() const;
1115 bool InstanceOf(const kStr&in className) const; ///< example: InstanceOf("kexPuppet")
1116 void PlaySound(const kStr&in soundPath);
1117 void PlaySoundWithLookupID(const int soundID);
1118 void StopSound();
1119 void StopLoopingSounds();
1120 const int GameTicks() const;
1121 kAnimState& AnimState();
1122 kRenderModel@ RenderModel();
1123 const bool InWater() const;
1124 bool CheckPosition(const kVec3&in origin); ///< checks if the actor can move to this location
1125 bool CheckPosition(const float angle, const float distance); ///< calls CheckPosition(kVec3 origin) with origin being: Actor.Origin() + (angle*distance*Actor.Radius())
1126 float GetTurnYaw(const kVec3&in lookAtLocation) const;
1127 float GetAvoidanceAngle(const kVec3&in lookAtLocation, const float distance);
1128 const float GetWaterHeight() const;
1129 const bool CanSee(kActor@ actor, const uint excludeClipFlags = 0); ///< excludeClipFlags to ignore/disable (EnumClipFlags)
1130 uint& ClipFlags(); ///< EnumClipFlags
1131 kDictMem@ Definition(); ///< get actors def data
1132 bool OnGround() const;
1133 int GetWaterLevel() const; ///< EnumWaterLevel
1134 kActor@ CastToActor(); ///< Casts to a kActor. Only used for kPuppet Actor().
1135 kAI@ CastToAI(); ///< Casts to kAI. returns null if isn't a kAI.
1136 kFx @SpawnProjectile(const kStr&in fxPath, const kVec3&in pos, const kVec3&in targetLocation, const float maxAngle); ///< Returns the first Fx spawned. targetLocation.z gets added by GAME_SCALE * 3.0f
1137 void MeleeObject(const kStr&in damageType, const kVec3&in offset, const float radius);
1138 kFx @SpawnFx(const kStr&in fxPath, const kVec3&in pos);
1139 kFx @SpawnFx(const kStr&in fxPath, const kVec3&in pos, const kQuat&in rot);
1140 kVec3 GetTransformedVector(const kVec3&in vector);
1141 float DistanceToPoint(const kVec3&in point) const; ///< calls DistanceToPoint(x,y,z)
1142 float DistanceToPoint(const float x, const float y, const float z) const; ///< actors point is in the center
1143 void InflictGenericDamage(kActor@ inflictor, const int damage);
1144 void InflictGenericDamage(kActor@ inflictor, const kexStr &damageDef, const int damage); ///< Can pass in a damage def. The damageDef keys used are mainly for custom scripting purposes only. Only the following keys are used internally when calling this function: bImpact, impactDamp, impactFalloff, bKnockback, knockBackForce
1145 void InflictDamage(kActor@ inflictor, const kStr&in damageDef);
1146 /**
1147 * @brief Calls a script function on all actors that are in the AreaNodes (KD-Tree search) contained inside a bounds. The bounds is calculated as: pos + this actors bounds(model bounds) + this actors radius. This will call for actors not necessarily in the bounds of the actor so checking distance is required in your script function.
1148 * @param pos The world position of where to check for actors
1149 * @param callbackFunc a function on this actors script class that will be called (if it exists) for each actor in range. function header must be: void callbackFunc(kActor@ actor, const float arg1, const float arg2, const float arg3, const float arg4)
1150 */
1151 void InteractActorsAtPosition(const kVec3&in pos, const kStr&in callbackFunc, const float arg1 = 0, const float arg2 = 0, const float arg3 = 0, const float arg4 = 0);
1152 kScriptObject@ ScriptObject();
1153 void MoveToPosition(const float x, const float y); ///< Moves the world object to a desired position at xy coordinates. Movement will use hitscan collision for quick collision tests.
1154 bool RandomDecision(const int randomBit) const; ///< randomBit should be >= 2. if a random value has the bit set and actors GameTicks also has the bit set then returns true.
1155 void SetPosition(const kVec3&in pos, const bool clearInterpolation = true); ///< best way to set an actors position (if you don't know the sector), will also set the sector and optionally clear interpolation
1156
1157 /**
1158 * @brief Get a map actors param value
1159 * @param paramID
1160 * (0) Target ID -32768..32767
1161 * (1) Trigger Anim 0..255
1162 * (2) Health -32768..32767
1163 * (3) Max Regenerations -32768..32767
1164 * (4) Attach Chance 0..255
1165 * (5) Texture -128..127
1166 * (6) Params 2 -128..127
1167 * (7) Params 1 -128..127
1168 */
1169 const int16 SpawnParams(const int paramID) const;
1170 const float GetCeilingHeight() const; ///< calculates the ceiling height from the actors sector and origin. Returns 0 if not in a sector.
1171 const float GetFloorHeight() const; ///< calculates the floor height from the actors sector and origin. Returns 0 if not in a sector.
1172 void RunFxEvent(const kStr&in fxEventName); ///< Runs an ActorFX event. Example: RunFxEvent("Enemy_Freeze");
1173 bool FxEventActive(); ///< Returns true if FxEvent is running
1174 const int GetSectorIndexAtLocation(const kVec3&in pos, uint excludeClipFlags = 0); ///< excludeClipFlags to ignore/disable (EnumClipFlags)
1175 void MarkPersistentBit(const bool clear);
1176 const bool IsPersistentMarked();
1177 void SetHeadTrackTarget(kActor@ actor);
1178 void ClearInterpolation();
1179 void AutomapToggle(const bool show); ///< Use with Game.AutomapCustom(true);
1180 void SetAutomapColor(const int r, const int g, const int b);
1181
1182 /**
1183 * @brief Sets the actors param value. all params are int16.
1184 * @param param
1185 * (0) Target ID -32768..32767
1186 * (1) Trigger Anim 0..255
1187 * (2) Health -32768..32767
1188 * (3) Max Regenerations -32768..32767
1189 * (4) Attach Chance 0..255
1190 * (5) Texture -128..127
1191 * (6) Params 2 -128..127
1192 * (7) Params 1 -128..127
1193 * @param value
1194 */
1195 void SetSpawnParams(const int param, const int16 value);
1196 void SetSpawnFlags1(const uint flags); ///< EnumActorSpawnFlags1
1197 void SetSpawnFlags2(const uint flags); ///< EnumActorSpawnFlags2
1198 void SetSpawnFlags3(const uint flags); ///< EnumActorSpawnFlags3
1199 void SetupSpawnParams(); ///< call after setting your actors spawnflags for them to take effect on the kActor
1200 void SetCustomDeadHeight(const bool bUse, const float height); ///< Height of actor when they are dead. Only for non map actors. (actors spawned with ActorFactory)
1201 const float GetCustomDeadHeight();
1202 const bool GetUsingCustomDeadHeight();
1203 const bool OverridingKeyTouchTID(); ///< used only for key pickups
1204 const int16 GetOverrideKeyTouchTID(); ///< used only for key pickups
1205 void OverrideKeyTouchTID(const bool bOverride, const int16 tid); ///< used only for key pickups to tell what key it is in the hub
1206 bool& SkipKeyTouchCinema(); ///< used only for key pickups
1207 void SetModel(kStr&in modelFile, kStr&in animFile); ///< a way to set the model/anim for actors that had no model set previously
1208 bool& TriggerInvincibility(); ///< Can't damage if true. Gets set to true if enemy has trigger anim and false when activated.
1209 bool &DrawDelay(); ///< Don't draw until has ticked once.
1210 void GetBoundsMinMax(kVec3&out min, kVec3&out max) const; ///< actor must not be sleeping and have a model set and not be a pickup. otherwise will return default min/max values of (-128, -128, -128) (128, 128, 128). Sets the min and max kVec3 values (the actors origin is added to the values)
1211 const int MapActorIndex() const; ///< Returns -1 if not a map actor
1212 int& DifficultyMode(); ///< The difficulty this actor is currently set to
1213 void OverrideOnDamageValue(const int damage, const bool bOverride = true); ///< call in OnPreDamage
1214 bool& NoKnockBack(); ///< Will not receive knock back movement from things like the alien weapon for example.
1215 const float BaseHeight() const; ///< height of actor when spawned or when kAI regenerated
1216 void RunAction(const int funcID, const float w = 0.0f, const float x = 0.0f, const float y = 0.0f, const float z = 0.0f); ///< run a function on the actor defined in defs/animActions.txt
1217 float& AirFriction(); ///< default = 1.0f
1218 float& WaterFriction(); ///< default = 0.5f (same as Friction)
1219 float& Mass(); ///< default = GAME_SCALE * 1.0f
1220 const float GetSkyHeight() const;
1221 bool &ChildOfTarget(void); ///< if this actors Target is an actor that belongs to the owner of the Fx, explosion or melee attack then won't collide/get damaged.
1222 kVec3 DamageOrigin(void) const; ///< The Origin point of the attacker (Fx, Actor, or null (returns this actors origin in that case)) who damaged this actor last. Gets set before OnPreDamage.
1223 kVec3 DamageVelocity(void) const; ///< The Velocity of the attacker (Fx, Actor, or null (returns this actors velocity in that case)) who damaged this actor last. Gets set before OnPreDamage.
1224 const bool CanSee(kPuppet@ puppet, const uint excludeClipFlags = 0); ///< excludeClipFlags to ignore/disable (EnumClipFlags). Note: This function that takes in the kPuppet arg is only available for kActor, not for kPuppet or kAI or kWeapon.
1225 const kVec3 &PrevLerpOrigin(void) const;
1226 const kQuat &PrevLerpRotation(void) const;
1227 const kAngle &PrevLerpPitch(void) const;
1228 const kAngle &PrevLerpRoll(void) const;
1229 const kAngle &PrevLerpYaw(void) const;
1230 const int RefCount() const; ///< Returns the number of references there are to this actor. If actor is stale and RefCount is 0 then it will be removed after the actor ticks.
1231 bool HasCustomRef(void) const;
1232 void AddCustomRef(void); ///< Keeps the actor from getting freed from memory.
1233 void ClearCustomRef(void); ///< Allows the actor to get freed from memory if it has no references. This will be called automatically when level is unloaded.
1234 void SetupHeadTrack(const kStr &in headTrackDef); ///< Sets a headtrack
1235 float &SoundPitchModify(); ///< Override the final pitch of sounds owned by this actor. A value of 1000 raises the pitch by the amount tiny cheat does. A value of -1000 lowers the pitch by the amount the big head cheat does. Set to 0 to stop overriding. if less than 1 will override with no pitch change so tiny and big head mode don't affect it.
1236 void RotateAroundOrigin(const kAngle &in angle, const kVec3 &in platformOrigin, const bool setPos = true); ///< The angle amount to rotate this actors position. if setPos is true will use SetPosition to position the actor else will use MoveToPosition.
1237 void LinkArea(); ///< Links the actor to an area node so that internally the actor can be found in quick searches (similar to a kd-tree) for explosive damage radius checks, when InteractActorsAtPosition is called, kAI GetAttention checks, and collision checks against actors. Should only call whenever you set the actors Origin() directly. Calling MoveToPosition or SetPosition or when the actors movement is updated by velocity changes or by gravity then LinkArea will be called internally.
1238 void CheckLinkArea(); ///< If origin or radius changed since the last LinkArea then calls LinkArea else does nothing. Links the Actor to an area node so that internally the Actor can be found in quick searches (similar to a kd-tree).
1239 float SoundPlayTime(const kStr &in file); ///< returns -1 if sound is not playing. Returns the amount of time in seconds the sound has been playing for. file is the "wavefile" property in the sound shader.
1240 bool &RemoveTrailsOnAnimChange(); ///< Will remove all model trails on this actor when animation is set/blend
1241 const float GetCurrentGameSpeed(void) const; ///< Gamespeed of this Actor (default 1.0f)
1242 void SetCurrentGameSpeed(const float speed); ///< Set Gamespeed of this Actor (default 1.0f)
1243 bool &IgnoreGameSpeed(); ///< GameSpeed used for this actor will be CurrentGameSpeed. (Default is true for kPuppet and kPlayerWeapon. Default is False for every other actor)
1244 bool &IgnoreFxGameSpeed(); ///< GameSpeed used for Fx whose source is this actor will always be CurrentGameSpeed. (Default is false)
1245 const float GetGameSpeed() const; ///< Returns CurrentGameSpeed if IgnoreGameSpeed is true else returns CurrentGameSpeed * GlobalGameSpeed.
1246 kFx @DamageFx() const; ///< The kFx that hit this actor. Will be null if no Fx hit this actor. Only use in OnPreDamage/OnDamage/OnDeath. Do not use anywhere else or it could be pointing to a random place in memory then the game will crash!
1247 const float DecayTime(void); ///< Value used to melt kAI when they regen. Values range from 0.0 (normal) to 60.0 (fully melted).
1248 void SetDecayTime(const float value); ///< Used to melt kAI when they regen. Value range should be 0 (normal) to 60 (fully melted).
1249 float RadiusDamageFactor(const kVec3 &in origin, const float radius) const;
1250 bool &UseNewExplosiveRadiusCheck(void); ///< (default False) Set to true to enable explosive damage checks from radius to actor cylinder(more accurate) instead of radius to actors center point.
1251};

1253/**
1254 * @class kActorIterator
1255 * @brief The way to iterate through all actors in the map. Example code:
1256 * @code{.cpp}
1257 * kActorIterator it;
1258 * kActor @actor;
1259 * while((@actor = it.Get()) !is null)
1260 * {
1261 * // Do something with actor
1262 * }
1263 * @endcode
1264 */
1265class kActorIterator
1266{
1267public:
1268 kActorIterator();
1269 kActor@ Get(); ///< Returns the next actor in the iterator
1270 void Reset(); ///< Resets the iterator back to the first actor
1271};

1273class kWeapon : public kActor
1274{
1275public:
1276 kVec3 TransformToOwnerPosition(); ///< returns the OffsetPosition() * the players matrix.
1277 kVec3 TransformToOwnerPosition(const kVec3&in vector); ///< returns the (OffsetPosition() + vector) * the players matrix.
1278
1279 /**
1280 * @brief SpawnsFx at the players at the position passed in * players rotation, then adds the
1281 * viewHeight + landingViewOffset to the z position. Sets PF_FIREDPROJECTILE PlayerFlags.
1282 * adjustToPerspective will change the position you pass in like this:
1283 * @code{.cpp}
1284 * float d = kexMath::Pow(47.5f / fov, fov / 60.0f);
1285 * vOrigin.y *= d;
1286 * vOrigin.z += (1.0f - d) * 2.0f;
1287 * @endcode
1288 */
1289 kFx @FireProjectile(const kStr&in fxPath, const float x, const float y, const float z, const bool adjustToPerspective = false);
1290 bool& PreventFire(); ///< Use in OnBeginFire to internally prevent from entering its Fire state.
1291 bool &NoGenericBobbing(); ///< Disables the generic weapon bobbing menu option from affecting this weapon
1292 kVec3& OffsetPosition(); ///< Offset position of weapon
1293 int& State(); ///< EnumWeaponStates
1294 bool &AllowUnderwater(); ///< Set to true to allow the weapon underwater. Gets reset back to the weapons def value after OnBeginLevel.
1295 kPlayer& Owner();
1296 bool &ClearInterpolationOffsetPosition(); ///< Set to true to clear the OffsetPosition interpolation after the weapon ticks, then it gets set back to false.
1297 float &PlaySpeed(); ///< Get/Set speed of weapon animations (default = 4.0f)
1298 float &PlaySpeedSwapIn(); ///< Get/Set speed of weapon lower animation (default = 4.0f)
1299 float &PlaySpeedSwapOut(); ///< Get/Set speed of weapon raise animation (default = 3.0f)
1300 float &FOV(); ///< Get/Set weapon FOV (default = 47.5f)
1301 bool &NoWalkAnim(); ///< Get/Set the usage of the walk anim. Run animation will be used instead.
1302 bool &ForceGenericBobbing();
1303
1304};

1460 void MoveToPosition(const float x, const float y); ///< Moves the world object to a desired position at xy coordinates. Movement will use hitscan collision for quick collision tests.
1461 void SetPosition(const kVec3 &in pos, const bool clearInterpolation = true); ///< best way to set an Fx position without knowing the sector, will also find/set the sector and optionally clear interpolation

1733 /**
1734 * @brief Returns an area arg value
1735 * @param areaID
1736 * @param arg
1737 @code{.cpp}
1738
1739 though args can be used for anything, they are typically used in this fashion:
1740 0: warp ID
1741 1: warp level ID or trigger sound ID
1742 2: checkpoint ID
1743 3: tag ID
1744 4: floor damage hit points
1745 5: floor damage rate
1746
1747 Hardcoded:
1748 0: AAF_TELEPORT: WarpID
1749 1: AAF_TELEPORT: WarpLevelID, AAF_EVENT and AAF_EVENTSOUND: soundID to play when player enters sector
1750 2: AAF_CHECKPOINT or AAF_SAVEGAME: CheckpointID
1751 3: AAF_EVENT: tag ID
1752 4: Not used
1753 5: AAF_SECRET: the secret index value (set automatically when level loads starting at 0. Conflicts with AAF_DAMAGE (so I guess no secrets should be placed on damage sectors))
1754
1755 Default Scripts:
1756 0: Not used
1757 1: Not used
1758 2: Not used
1759 3: Not used
1760 4: AAF_DAMAGE: amount of damage to do to the player when they're on the ground
1761 5: Always used as floor damage delay no matter the AAF flags. Should be used with AAF_DAMAGE only. 1 second = 1024
1762 @endcode
1763 */
1764 const int16 GetAreaArg(const int areaID, const int arg) const;
1765
1766 /**
1767 * @brief
1768 * @param areaID
1769 * @param arg
1770 @code{.cpp}
1771
1772 though args can be used for anything, they are typically used in this fashion:
1773 0: warp ID
1774 1: warp level ID or trigger sound ID
1775 2: checkpoint ID
1776 3: tag ID
1777 4: floor damage hit points
1778 5: floor damage rate
1779
1780 Hardcoded:
1781 0: AAF_TELEPORT: WarpID
1782 1: AAF_TELEPORT: WarpLevelID, AAF_EVENT and AAF_EVENTSOUND: soundID to play when player enters sector
1783 2: AAF_CHECKPOINT or AAF_SAVEGAME: CheckpointID
1784 3: AAF_EVENT: tag ID
1785 4: Not used
1786 5: AAF_SECRET: the secret index value (set automatically when level loads starting at 0. Conflicts with AAF_DAMAGE (so I guess no secrets should be placed on damage sectors))
1787
1788 Default Scripts:
1789 0: Not used
1790 1: Not used
1791 2: Not used
1792 3: Not used
1793 4: AAF_DAMAGE: amount of damage to do to the player when they're on the ground
1794 5: Always used as floor damage delay no matter the AAF flags. Should be used with AAF_DAMAGE only. 1 second = 1024
1795 @endcode
1796 * @param value
1797 */
